intro: Drosanthemopsis kwaganapensis, commonly known as the Kwaganapensis drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are usually yellow or orange, bloom in the spring and attract various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in botanical gardens and by succulent enthusiasts.
